meaning_str.bing:
n. 月亮；月球；卫星
v. 闲逛；发呆；〈俚〉光屁股示人
网络. 月光；明月；月状物

闲逛；发呆；〈俚〉光屁股示人

月亮；月球；卫星；月光；月状物；（Moon）穆恩（人名）
<非正式>（为侮辱或恶作剧）弯腰向别人露出光屁股；亮出臀部；闲荡；闲混；浪荡

1.en: As the nearest celestial body to our Earth, the Moon has, of course, always been a favored object for the amateur astronomer.
1.cn: 月球是最接近地球的天体，当然总是业余天文学家喜爱的对象。

2.en: But after 1969, the Soviets dropped out of the race to the moon and, like a cancer, the land war in Asia began to devour the budget.
2.cn: 不过，1969年之后，苏维埃退出了登月竞赛。而且就像癌症一样，亚洲的地面战争开始吞噬预算。

3.en: On the feast of the New Moon the young Emperor came forth from his palace and went into the mosque to pray.
3.cn: ‘新月节’上，年轻的皇帝径直从他的皇宫里去往清真寺祷告。

1.en: That's what they said to Neil Armstrong about the moon.
1.cn: 关于月球，当年他们也是对阿姆斯特朗[登月第一人]也是这么说的。

2.en: Welcome to the moon shop. We've got moon maps, moon books and we've even got a picture of piggies on the moon with an elephant.
2.cn: 欢迎来到月球商店。我们有月球地图，月球书籍甚至还有佩奇和埃德蒙在月球上的照片。

3.en: Moon, moon. George is pretending that the bouncy ball is the moon. I was playing with that ball. Oh.
3.cn: 月球，月球。乔治把佩奇的弹力球当成了月球。我现在还在玩这个球呢。

4.en: Look there we are, jumping on the moon. We've got moon rock, too. It got a picture of the moon all the way through the middle. Woo.
4.cn: 看，我们在这儿，在月球上跳来跳去。我们还有月球岩石。它中间有个月球的图案，从头到尾都有。哇。

5.en: Here we are, on the moon. It's a pretend moon, really, isn't it? Yes, if this was the real moon, you could jump over my head.
5.cn: 现在我们在月球上了。这是一个模拟的月球吧，对不对？是的，如果这个是真的月球，你就能一下子跳到我头上。

6.en: Why can you jump so high on the moon? The gravitational pull is smaller on the moon.
6.cn: 在月球上我们为什么可以跳那么高？在月球上地心引力变弱了。

7.en: Are there any castles on the moon? No Are there any moon shops? No. That would be silly.
7.cn: 那月球上面有汽车吗？没有。那月球上面有商店吗？没有，那样太不正常了。

8.en: That is an up balloon. If you let it go, it will go up and up and up, all the way to the moon. Moon.
8.cn: 这是一个往上飞的气球。如果你放手了，这个就会往上飞得越来越高，一直飞到月球上！月球！

9.en: Will we really have to go to the moon? No, Peppa, we are not going to the moon. We are going to the museum. Okay.
9.cn: 那我们是真的要去月球吗？不是的，佩奇，我们不是真的要去月球。我们是要去博物馆。好的。

10.en: I like the moon now because it's very interesting. And very tasty.
10.cn: 我现在喜欢月球了，因为在月球上非常有意思。吃起来也非常美味。

11.en: There you are. Enjoy your trip to the moon. Ooh, we really are going to the moon. No, Peppa, it's just pretend.
11.cn: 请拿好。好好享受你们的月球之旅。哦，我们是真的要去月球上吗。不是的，佩奇，这只不过是模拟的。

12.en: My Dad sells rocks in packs of five. Yes, thank you, Freddy. You don't need to go to the moon to get them. You do if you want moon rock.
12.cn: 我爸爸五个一盒卖这种石头。是的，谢谢，弗雷德。你不需要去月球上找他们呢。你如果想要月球上的石头你就需要这么做。

13.en: But I wouldn't trade this experience for a trip to the moon.
13.cn: 但这份经历就算拿月球旅行我也不换。

14.en: Everyone is scrapping into Mr. Rabbit's anti-Gravity rubber bands. Bouncing on the pretend moon is fun. Say moon cheese. Moon cheese.
14.cn: 大家都系上了兔先生的反重力的弹力绳。在月球上这样跳很有趣。说月亮茄子。月亮茄子。

15.en: We locked them away forever. And the moon program was shut down.
15.cn: 把它们永久性的封存起来,而月球项目从此停止。

16.en: Next, we are going to steal, pause for effect, the moon!
16.cn: 接下来 我们要去偷的是，这时候停顿一下才给力，月球！

17.en: George, your balloon is going to the moon. You'll never see it again.
17.cn: 乔治，你的气球要去月球了。你再也看不见它了。

18.en: Well then you tell NASA to move heaven and earth. We need to get to the moon.
18.cn: 那你让航空航天局竭尽全力，我们要上月球。

19.en: Gravity is what keeps us on the ground. It is weaker on the moon, so you can jump higher. We can make you feel like you are jumping on the moon with a help of science.
19.cn: 因为重力才能让我们像这样站在地球上。而在月球上重力小了，所以你能跳得很高。在科学的帮助下，我们可以让你们感觉就像在月球上跳一样。
